bibl.title: Monastic Life vs. Urban Society: Two Trends in Alexandria before Islam. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Between A.D. 451 and A.D. 642, the religious differences between Egypt and Byzantium helped to spread monasticism in the outskirts of Alexandria while fostering disturbances of political, economic and social conditions inside the city.

bibl.title: Alexandrian Studies in memoriam Daoud Abdu Daoud

bibl.seg: YOUSSEF Joseph Nessim †, Monastic Life vs. Urban Society: Two Trends in Alexandria before Islam. Avec résumé en anglais.
Alexandrian Studies in memoriam Daoud Abdu Daoud = BSAA 45 (1993) pp. 405-411.

Between A.D. 451 and A.D. 642, the religious differences between Egypt and Byzantium helped to spread monasticism in the outskirts of Alexandria while fostering disturbances of political, economic and social conditions inside the city.
